docs.text:
Find out which phone works best with IRL Pro App

Best Phones

Guides

FAQ

docs.title: Contribute
docs.text: Contribute

• Add ability to reverse the landscape direction
  • Remove broken halt render option
  • Add about us and version to settings page
  • Fix zoom when there is no chat box
  • Fix mute ui bug when coming out of settings

• Add chat options for bots/commands
  • Add network tab to quick settings
  • Add ability to adjust bitrate on the fly (This may break)
  • Add alert box scale
• Add stats to network tab
• Turn off hold locks by default and make more obvious
• Allow import/export of settings + web widgets

• Attempted at new adaptive bitrate algo (SRT Only), very aggressive drop and increase, experimental
  • Fix adaptive fps, it never worked, I don't think it even worked in Larix either lol
• Further improve bitrate drops on switching cam (I had a shower thought last night on how to make it better lol)
• Fix a couple of crashes
• Just some text tweaks
• More crash fixes

• Typos
  • Fix quick popup camera selector
  • Chat username strip spaces
  • Default OIS on
  • New Android Zoom API

• Support YouTube HEVC (HLS)!! (Uses bonding service)
    • Redo bonding page UI

• Fix StreamElements activity feed (was broken if using new version)
  • Fix zoom bug when switching cams (disabling save zoom feature, it was a bit borky anyway)
  • Auto enable OIS and EIS (and only show eis/ois icons if on)
  • Fix EIS on <70 fov lenses on S23
  • Enable further zoom if supported (10x zoom on S23)

• Add support for multiple alert activity dashboards, add toonation
  • Add support for multiple platform chats
  • Add support for kick (chat + view count/title)

• Add changelog
  • Add a lock screen option (Quick settings -> Display). Useful if streaming in the rain.
  • Some crash fixes
• Add ability to toggle chat on and off whilst streaming

• SRTLA initial implementation
  • Adaptive bitrate tweaks

• Important! Codec now defaults to auto for new users, will use H264 for RTMP, HEVC for all others.
  • Important! Starting and stopping stream now has a confirm dialog
  • Connection wizard create for Twitch and Kick
  • Anti-Flicker defaults to auto
  • Add ability to toggle stream mirror in Quick Settings
  • Add ability to edit the text of a text overlay in Quick Settings
  • Option to clear all web overlay and alert overlay cookies (if need to change accounts etc)
  • Option to enable geo api for web overlays, so can use things like realtimeirl
  • Easier changing of currently active connection (don't have to uncheck first)
  • Other misc fixes

Because there was a fairly significant rework of the connection start process, this one will remain alpha for a bit to confirm no issues

• UI Tweaks, made camera buttons smaller
  • Hide duplicate cameras on initial load
  • Add options to move chat box to the right, or left margin (for lenses)
  • Some tweaks to adaptive + srtla
  • Improve overlay reload to stagger the reloads (Reduce burst load)

• Reduces bitrate drop on switching cam
  • Adds more bonding stats
  • Adds experimental srtla tweaks (Enable in advanced settings), testing some bonding enhancements
  • Also added an experimental irl pro auto bitrate algo option, but no changes yet

docs.title: Contributing
Server
docs.text:
• OBS
  • Belabox

docs.title: Phones
docs.text: Known working and non-working phones.

docs.title: good 30fps
docs.text:
• Zenfone 9 - 2022
  • G8s - 2019

docs.title: Zenfone 9 - 2022
docs.text:
Works great

  • natural colors
  • good stabilized (build in gimbal)
  • no overheating while charging/LTE/WIFI and ofc streaming
  • Audio Jack
  • only 1080@30fps

docs.title: Main Cameras
docs.text:
• 50 MP, f/1.9, 24mm (wide), 1/1.56", 1.0µm, multi-directional PDAF, gimbal OIS
  • 12 MP, f/2.2, 14mm, 113° (ultrawide), ½.55", 1.4µm, Dual Pixel PDAF

Video

8K@24fps, 4K@30/60/120fps, 1080p@30/60/240fps; gyro-EIS, HDR

docs.title: Selfie Camera
docs.text:
• 12 MP, f/2.5, 28mm (standard), ½.93", 1.22µm, Dual Pixel PDAF

Video

4K@30fps, 1080p@30/60fps

docs.title: Connectivity
docs.text:
• Wi-Fi 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac/6e, dual-band, Wi-Fi Direct
  • Bluetooth 5.2, A2DP, LE, aptX HD, aptX Adaptive, aptX Lossless
  • GPS (L1+L5), GLONASS (L1), BDS (B1I+B1c+B2a), GALILEO (E1+E5a), QZSS (L1+L5), NavIC (L5)
  • USB Type-C, OTG
  • Audio jack

docs.title: Battery
docs.text:
• Li-Po 4300 mAh, non-removable
  • Quick Charge 4.0

docs.title: Display
docs.text:
• 5.9 inches (1080 x 2400 pixels)
  • Super AMOLED, 120Hz, HDR10+, 1100 nits (peak)

docs.title: G8s - 2019
docs.text:
LMG810EAW

Works great

  • natural colors
  • fairly good stabilized
  • no overheating while charging/LTE/WIFI and ofc streaming
  • UVC works
  • Audio Jack
  • low light is average
  • only 30fps (but up to 3840x2160)

docs.title: Main Cameras
docs.text:
• 12 MP, f/1.8, 27mm (wide), 1.4µm, PDAF, OIS
  • 12 MP, f/2.6, 49mm (telephoto), 1.0µm, PDAF, 2x optical zoom
  • 13 MP, f/2.4, 14mm (ultrawide), 1.0µm

Video

4K@30/60fps, 1080p@30/60fps, 1080p@240fps, HDR

docs.title: Selfie Camera
docs.text:
• 8 MP, f/1.9, 26mm (wide), ¼", 1.12µm, AF
  • TOF 3D, f/1.4, (depth sensor)

Video

1080p@60fps

docs.title: Connectivity
docs.text:
• Wi-Fi 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac, dual-band, Wi-Fi Direct, DLNA
  • Bluetooth 5.0, A2DP, LE, aptX HD
  • GPS, GLONASS, GALILEO, BDS
  • USB Type-C 3.1, OTG
  • Audio jack

docs.title: Battery
docs.text:
• Li-Po 3550 mAh, non-removable
  • Quick Charge 3.0

docs.title: Display
docs.text:
• 6.21 inches (1080 x 2248 pixels)
  • G-OLED, HDR10
